title: 3 men charged with attempted murder in shooting near school
content:
PORTLAND, Ore. -- Three suspects have been charged with attempted murder, among other charges, in connection with a shooting outside of a North Portland high school.
On Dec. 12, four people were hit by gunfire during their lunch break at Rosemary Anderson High School. A 16-year-old girl was critically injured. Two men, 17 and 20, were seriously injured and another teen's foot was grazed by a bullet.
All victims were affiliated with the school, either as students or in job training.
Police later arrested three people in connection with the shooting.
Marquise Murphy, 16, Marquel Dugas, 18, and Lonzo Murphy, 22, were all charged with attempted murder, assault and unlawful use of a weapon, police said.
Dugas was also charged with felon in possession of a firearm. Lonzo Murphy was charged with felon in possession of a firearm, hindering prosecution and tampering with evidence.
